DOC.HEAD: America West Jetliner Runs Off Tucson Runway
Eds: LEADS in 4 grafs with airline official saying 127 people on board, sted 118, no one hospitalized overnight; pick up 5th graf, `The airliner ...'
DOC.TEXT: An America West jetliner skidded off the end of the runway at Tucson International Airport on Saturday night, and three of 127 people aboard were hurt, authorities said. The Boeing 737, Flight 450 from Phoenix, apparently lost hydraulic pressure while landing at 7:05 p.m. (9:05 p.m. EST), airport spokeswoman Paula Morgan said. The plane carried 122 passengers and a crew of five, said Dick Shimizu, an America West spokesman at company headquarters in Tempe. One passenger complained of chest pains after the landing and two complained of neck injuries, Ms. Morgan said. They were taken to hospitals. Shimizu said nobody who was injured was hospitalized overnight. The airliner ended up nose down about 100 yards west of the airport perimeter fence after the nose gear collapsed, Ms. Morgan said. Passengers were removed from the plane through emergency chutes on the side. Emergency equipment was rushed to the scene. Bill Kuhn, 19, of Tucson, who was at the airport waiting for a friend from Tennessee and watched the landing, said: ``The plane just flew down the runway, it wasn't stopping. I immediately knew something was wrong.'' He said airport officials told relatives and friends that the plane suffered an hydraulic leak and that the tires blew, causing it to go off the runway. Ms. Morgan also said the rough landing was related to an hydraulic leak.
